body: @mcollina I don't believe this is true. The fastify types reexport the pino.Logger so it should be a dependency as it is now.
As `abstract-logging` is used as the fallback logger, errors will occur when pino methods applied on it. The fastify types should export exact, minimum interfaces.
I really donâ€™t understand what the problem is.
If it's possible to provide the correct typings for the logger when it's not a pino instance, that would probably be the best approach.
So, the fastify types should not reexport `pino.Logger`. As a result, `@types/pino` can be moved out of `dependencies `.

I understand the problem, but it will also happen in js if the logger is disabled.
This is not a TypeScript issue, but a wider one, that can be fixed in various ways, starting from a note in the documentation, to extending the API surface of `abstract-logging`.

I don't see this one as a critical issue since there is no point to interact with the logger so heavily (`log.addListener`) and then disable it, but if someone wants to send a fix I'm happy to review it.
